alert.note: Alert for Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:57PM EDT until July 11 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... New Hampshire... Connecticut River At West Lebanon affecting Windsor, Sullivan, Grafton and Orange Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at West Lebanon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Water starts entering the parking lot of the shopping plaza in West Lebanon just north of Interstate 89 along Main Street in Lebanon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:46 PM EDT Monday the stage was 22.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:46 PM EDT Monday was 22.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
